item.title: Bed left in private parking space, 18th September
item.description:
Furniture was left for official large waste collection over night, overnight this was taken by passers by however somebody took the opportunity to leave a bed as a replacement - this was not taken as part of the large waste collection due to it not being mine and included on the list of items.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Warner Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin still being used to reserve parking space, 18th September
item.description:
Despite several reports a bin is still being used to reserve a parking space outside number 28 Pickwick Road for a silver Mercedes sports car. Can this please be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickwick Road, Dulwich Village, London

item.title: Persistent flytipping, 18th September
item.description:
For at least four years, there has been an ongoing issue with flytipping in this spot (behind the bins opposite 107-110 Adams Gardens Estate). The area is occasionally cleared but new rubbish is dumped almost weekly. More stringent measures need to be taken to prevent this recurring, perhaps CCTV to aid enforcement of FPNs, or the gap needs barricading.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tunnel Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag graffiti, 18th September
item.description:
This is getting worse, it looks like an attempt was made to paint over it and more has appeared. This could be done with racist intentions and needs to be painted over asap

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20 inch pothole entrance to St Martins School, 18th September
item.description:
The pot holes (2) has been here for 2 months plus. next to the drain outside St Martins School (what3words = tested.kicked.nasel) 2nd pot hole 10 foot away from the main pothole (what3words = types.middle.yappy)

item.title: Shopfront 88 & 163, 18th September
item.description:
RE: 7469962 Shops are using crates as retail displays for fruit and veg, blocking the pavement for pedestrians during the day & night. The rotting veg & fruit inbetween the crates attracts vermin at night as well, and all the stock is left out at night as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Allcroft Road, Gospel Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Council ignoring growing problem, 18th September
item.description:
This defacing of the zebra crossings is getting bigger and more worrying for local residents. Council needs to act now to stamp this out and continue to monitor situation.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lauriston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking St Johns Estate, 18th September
item.description:
It is totally unfair St John’s Estate residents pay upwards of £150 for parking despite living in an ESTATE! Estate parking costs are at £40.50. Why, despite living in an Estate are we not allocated a Z prefix parking zone? Total double standards.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Red tent near tennis club., 18th September
item.description:
This has been there for some time among the trees. Needs dealing with promptly. Three men seem to be living in it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queen Elizabeths Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
